required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy Weight at Home: A Pilot Weight Loss Program for Parents of Children With Vision Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Healthy Weight at Home: A Pilot Weight Loss Program for Parents of Children With Vision Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to design, implement, and pilot a lifestyle-based, 12-week, weight loss program for parents of children with vision impairment. This weight loss program takes a parent-only approach to promote healthier weight among children with vision impairment.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight change among the parents at week 12
primary_outcome.description: Examine weight change (12 week - baseline) in kilograms (kg) among the parents in the 12-week weight loss program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence with the scheduled weekly coaching calls
secondary_outcome.description: Examine the parent's adherence with the weekly coaching sessions using descriptive statistics, including percent, of coaching sessions attended.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight change among the parents at week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Examine weight change in kg (24 week - baseline) among the parents 12 weeks after the end of the weight loss program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in BMI z-score among the children
secondary_outcome.description: Examine changes (12 week - baseline and 24 week - baseline) in BMI-z score among the children.

intervention.description: Participants will receive recommendations on how to increase physical activity, decrease caloric intake, monitor their weight, and track the related behaviors and progress.

intervention.intervention_name: weight loss coaching sessions and email support
intervention.description: Participants will receive weekly coaching sessions and tailored support emails.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Parent
- age ≥18
- English speaking
- completion of screening and baseline data collection
- BMI ≥ 25 and weight < 300lbs (weight limit due to scale limitations)
- willing to lose weight through physical activity, weight tracking and decreased caloric intake
- willing to make changes at home to facilitate a healthy weight
- willing to complete 12 weekly weight loss video coaching sessions (20 minutes/session)
- willing to use Skype, FaceTime, Zoom, or WebEx for regular intervention contact
- Internet/ cellular plan that is sufficient for weekly program video conferencing
- willing to use the study scale with cellular technology to report weights at baseline, 12 weeks, and 24 weeks.
- willing to use the study scale with cellular technology at least weekly during the study (12 weeks)
- completion of screening and baseline data collection
Child
- age 8-18
- has vision impairment or is blind
- informed assent
- willing to have height taken (by parent) at baseline, 12 weeks, and 24 weeks.
- willing to use the scale with cellular technology to report weights at baseline, 12 weeks, and 24 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- parent or child: previously diagnosed eating disorder, or treatment for an eating disorder
- parent: currently pregnant or plan to get pregnant in the next 6 months
- parent: planned weight loss surgery or procedure in the next 6 months
